SingleUseCardsInfo.title: How do one-time cards work?
SingleUseCardsInfo.text:
They’re virtual debit cards that you can only use once, so they’re great for protecting yourself when you buy online.

When you generate a one-time card, you get a single-use card number, expiry and CVV. They’ll only work for one purchase and mean the merchant can’t see your real card details - so they’re a safer way to spend.

TransferLimitsModal.title: What are my transfer limits?
TransferLimitsModal.standardTransferExplanation: Send up to 20,000 SAR to added or saved beneficiaries. If you need to send more than this, the transfer will be processed through normal local bank transfer method without any change.
TransferLimitsModal.quickTransferExplanation: Send a one time transfer up to 2,500 SAR. Transfers of this type can be done via Email, ID number, Mobile Number or IBAN without saving the beneficiary. You have the option to configure your daily limit within the maximum range.
TransferLimitsModal.nonWorkingDaysExplanation: If you make a standard transfer on a non-working day, the transfer will be processed on the following working day.

sections.sectionOneContent: If you wish to activate this feature provided by the Instant Payments System (SARIE) and the rest of the related services, such as sending funds via alias like (mobile number), we inform you that by confirming this feature you are agreeing to share some of your data with SARIE system for the instant payments owned by the Saudi Central Bank (IBAN number, Mobile number, email address, National/Iqama ID number). At any time in the future, you may disable sharing this data via all banking channels such as mobile banking or internet banking.
